intro: Schizoglossum thorbeckei, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a perennial plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its deep root system and succulent stems. Schizoglossum thorbeckei is often found in rocky areas and is a symbol of resilience in desert ecosystems.
